column4: I just recently installed the most recent version of Ubuntu from Windows and my resolution is pathetic. Would someone be able to help me out with establishing a less "senior" look/
What GPU?
Where would I find that information?
System -> Preferenes -> Hardware information
All you probably need to know is the brand ( ATI, Nvidia, intel )
I will just have to message you in a moment, I'm going to attack this with the HowTo really fast. :P)
Whenever I try to boot now, it keeps telling me that it was unable to initialized xserver.
What did you do to try to fix the resolution?
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
What GPu do you have?
Have you tried installing the -intel driver?
I wouldn't even begin to know how.
Ok, do you know how to install packages in Ubuntu?
Not from prompt./

Oh, forgot you are stuck at a terminal, ok, from a terminal run these commands to install and configure the driver first: "sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-intel " then run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh" and choose "intel" as the driver
I'll try that.  Be right back.
I entered that information, shall I reboot?
You can either reboot or just run: sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
Hey! Awesome! It's working now... I did get a message saying, "Failed to Initialize HAL"
Do you know what that means?
I am not sure but it may mean that you will have problems with things like auto mounting external drives when they are plugged in
OK, thanks again!
np
